MachineIdentifier.label: A unique identifier for the machine

AcceptedEULA.label: Has the user accepted the EULA

ArticleStrings.label: Comma-separated list of strings considered articles when sorting titles. A server restart is required for a change to take effect.

TranscoderVideoResolutionLimit.label: Maximum video output resolution for the transcoder

PublishServerOnPlexOnlineKey.label: Publish server on Plex Online
PublishServerOnPlexOnlineKey.summary: Publishing a server makes it automatically available on your client devices without any configuration of your router.

WanPerStreamMaxUploadRate.label: Limit remote stream bitrate
WanPerStreamMaxUploadRate.summary: Set the maximum bitrate of a remote stream from this server.

WanTotalMaxUploadRate.label: External network total upload limit (kbps)
WanTotalMaxUploadRate.summary: Speed at which to limit the total bandwidth not on the local network in kilobits per second. Use 0 to set no limit.

LogTokensForDebug.label: Allow Plex Media Server tokens in logs
LogTokensForDebug.summary: Media server tokens can be used to gain access to library content. Don't share logs containing tokens publicly. A server restart is required for a change to take effect.

LogMemoryUse.label: Add Plex Media Server and System memory use for Debug Logging
LogMemoryUse.summary: Logging of the Plex Media Server memory use and the system total used memory in Plex Media Server logs. A server restart is required for the change to take effect.

FriendlyName.label: Friendly name
FriendlyName.summary: This name will be used to identify this media server to other computers on your network. If you leave it blank, your computer's name will be used instead.

sendCrashReports.label: Send crash reports to Plex
sendCrashReports.summary: This helps us improve your experience.

PushNotificationsEnabled.label: Push Notifications
PushNotificationsEnabled.summary: Allow this server to send push notifications to mobile devices. Note: Push notifications are delivered using Plex services. They're associated with your account, and some of them may contain information about the contents of your library.

logDebug.label: Enable Plex Media Server debug logging
logDebug.summary: Debug logging enables additional detail in the log files and is helpful in diagnosing problems.

LogVerbose.label: Enable Plex Media Server verbose logging
LogVerbose.summary: Verbose logging is only useful to debug specific issues and should only be enabled if requested by support staff.

FSEventLibraryUpdatesEnabled.label: Scan my library automatically
FSEventLibraryUpdatesEnabled.summary: Your library will be updated automatically when changes to library folders are detected.

FSEventLibraryPartialScanEnabled.label: Run a partial scan when changes are detected
FSEventLibraryPartialScanEnabled.summary: When changes to library folders are detected, only scan the folder that changed.

watchMusicSections.label: Include music libraries in automatic updates
watchMusicSections.summary: Linux systems limit the maximum number of watched directories; this may cause problems with large music libraries.

autoEmptyTrash.label: Empty trash automatically after every scan

allowMediaDeletion.label: Allow media deletion
allowMediaDeletion.summary: The owner of the server will be allowed to delete media files from disk.

OnDeckWindow.label: Weeks to consider for On Deck and Continue Watching
OnDeckWindow.summary: Media that has not been watched in this many weeks will not appear in On Deck or Continue Watching.

OnDeckLimit.label: Maximum number of On Deck items which will appear.
OnDeckLimit.summary: Limits the number of shows which will appear On Deck. Setting it too high can affect performance.

OnDeckIncludePremieres.label: Include season premieres in On Deck
OnDeckIncludePremieres.summary: New season premieres will always appear no matter how many weeks have passed since watching.

SmartShuffleMusic.label: Enable smart shuffling on artists and smart music playlists
SmartShuffleMusic.summary: Smart shuffling prefers highly rated, popular and less recently heard tracks.

ScannerLowPriority.label: Run scanner tasks at a lower priority

GenerateBIFBehavior.label: Generate video preview thumbnails
GenerateBIFBehavior.summary: Video preview thumbnails provide live updates in Now Playing and while seeking on supported apps. Thumbnail generation may take a long time, cause high CPU usage, and consume additional disk space. You can turn off thumbnail generation for individual libraries in the library's advanced settings.

GenerateBIFFrameInterval.label: Video preview thumbnail frame duration
GenerateBIFFrameInterval.summary: The time (in seconds) between each video preview frame.

GenerateIntroMarkerBehavior.label: Generate intro video markers
GenerateIntroMarkerBehavior.summary: Detects show intros, exposing the 'Skip Intro' button in clients.

GenerateChapterThumbBehavior.label: Generate chapter thumbnails
GenerateChapterThumbBehavior.summary: Chapter thumbnails provide images in the chapter view on supported apps. They can take a long time to generate and consume additional disk space.

LoudnessAnalysisBehavior.label: Analyze audio tracks for loudness
LoudnessAnalysisBehavior.summary: Loudness analysis allows various features, such as loudness leveling and smart transitions. It can take a long time to complete when analyzing many tracks, and cause high CPU usage.

LocationVisibility.label: Location visibility
LocationVisibility.summary: Server owners may wish to restrict who can see location names for items which contain geolocation metadata. By default only the server owner will have visibility of these.

CinemaTrailersFromLibrary.label: Include Cinema Trailers from movies in my library

CinemaTrailersFromTheater.label: Include Cinema Trailers from new and upcoming movies in theaters
CinemaTrailersFromTheater.summary: This feature is Plex Pass only.

CinemaTrailersFromBluRay.label: Include Cinema Trailers from new and upcoming movies on Blu-ray
CinemaTrailersFromBluRay.summary: This feature is Plex Pass only.

CinemaTrailersPrerollID.label: Movie pre-roll video
CinemaTrailersPrerollID.summary: Enter the full path to the pre-roll video file. If multiple paths separated by commas are entered, videos will be played sequentially. If multiple paths separated by semi-colons are used, a single pre-roll video will be chosen randomly from the list.

iTunesSharingEnabled.label: Enable iTunes plugin
iTunesSharingEnabled.summary: A server restart is required for a change to take effect.

disableCapabilityChecking.label: Disable capability checking
disableCapabilityChecking.summary: Capability checking ensures that plug-ins that are incompatible with this version of the server or the current client application you are using are hidden. Disabling capability checking is useful during development, but will enable access to plug-ins that may perform unreliably with certain client applications.

PluginsLaunchTimeout.label: Number of seconds to wait before a plugin times out

secureConnections.label: Secure connections
secureConnections.summary: When set to "Required", some unencrypted connections (originating from the Media Server computer) will still be allowed and apps that don't support secure connections will not be able to connect at all.

customCertificatePath.label: Custom certificate location
customCertificatePath.summary: Path to a PKCS #12 file containing a certificate and private key to enable TLS support on a custom domain.

customCertificateDomain.label: Custom certificate domain
customCertificateDomain.summary: Domain name to be published to plex.tv using your mapped port; must match a name from the custom certificate file.

PreferredNetworkInterface.label: Preferred network interface
PreferredNetworkInterface.summary: The network interface local clients will use to connect.

DisableTLSv1_0.label: Disable weak TLS versions
DisableTLSv1_0.summary: Disables the deprecated TLSv1.0 and v1.1 protocols, as well as legacy weak ciphers. May prevent older clients from connecting.

GdmEnabled.label: Enable local network discovery (GDM)
GdmEnabled.summary: This enables the media server to discover other servers and players on the local network.

WanPerUserStreamCount.label: Remote streams allowed per user
WanPerUserStreamCount.summary: Maximum number of simultaneous streams each user is allowed when not on the local network.

LanNetworksBandwidth.label: LAN Networks
LanNetworksBandwidth.summary: Comma separated list of IP addresses or IP/netmask entries for networks that will be considered to be on the local network when enforcing bandwidth restrictions. If set, all other IP addresses will be considered to be on the external network and will be subject to external network bandwidth restrictions. If left blank, only the server's subnet is considered to be on the local network.

MinutesAllowedPaused.label: Terminate Sessions Paused for Longer Than
MinutesAllowedPaused.summary: Value is in minutes. Terminate any sessions which have been paused for a longer time than specified amount of time.  Audio-only sessions and live sessions are excluded

TreatWanIpAsLocal.label: Treat WAN IP As LAN Bandwidth
TreatWanIpAsLocal.summary: Treat incoming requests from this network's WAN IP address as LAN requests in terms of bandwidth.  This often occurs when DNS rebinding protection is in place and clients on the LAN cannot contact the server directly but instead have to go through the WAN IP address.

RelayEnabled.label: Enable Relay
RelayEnabled.summary: The Relay allows connections to the server through a proxy relay when the server is not accessible otherwise.  Note: this proxy relay is bandwidth limited

customConnections.label: Custom server access URLs
customConnections.summary: A comma-separated list of URLs (http or https) which are published up to plex.tv for server discovery.

allowedNetworks.label: List of IP addresses and networks that are allowed without auth
allowedNetworks.summary: Comma separated list of IP addresses or IP/netmask entries for networks that are allowed to access Plex Media Server without logging in. When the server is signed out and this value is set, only localhost and addresses on this list will be allowed.

WebHooksEnabled.label: Webhooks
WebHooksEnabled.summary: Allow this server to send events to external services.

TranscoderQuality.label: Transcoder quality
TranscoderQuality.summary: Quality profile used by the transcoder.

SegmentedTranscoderTimeout.label: Segmented transcoder timeout
SegmentedTranscoderTimeout.summary: Timeout in seconds segmented transcodes wait for the transcoder to begin writing data.

TranscoderTempDirectory.label: Transcoder temporary directory
TranscoderTempDirectory.summary: Directory to use when transcoding for temporary files.

TranscoderDefaultDuration.label: Transcoder default duration
TranscoderDefaultDuration.summary: Duration in minutes to use when transcoding something with an unknown duration.

TranscoderThrottleBuffer.label: Transcoder default throttle buffer
TranscoderThrottleBuffer.summary: Amount in seconds to buffer before throttling the transcoder.

TranscoderPruneBuffer.label: Transcoder default prune buffer
TranscoderPruneBuffer.summary: Amount in past seconds to retain before pruning segments from a transcode.

TranscoderH264BackgroundPreset.label: Background transcoding x264 preset
TranscoderH264BackgroundPreset.summary: The x264 preset value used for background transcoding (Sync and Media Optimizer). Slower values will result in better video quality and smaller file sizes, but will take significantly longer to complete processing.

TranscoderToneMapping.label: Enable HDR tone mapping
TranscoderToneMapping.summary: Transcoded HDR content will appear highly dimmed and desaturated with this disabled. Additional driver components may be needed to support hardware transcoding with this feature enabled; see our support articles for further details.

TranscoderCanOnlyRemuxVideo.label: Disable video stream transcoding
TranscoderCanOnlyRemuxVideo.summary: Disable transcoding of the video stream in transcoder operations. With this set, the transcoder may still transcode audio as well as remux video.

HardwareAcceleratedCodecs.label: Use hardware acceleration when available
HardwareAcceleratedCodecs.summary: Plex Media Server will attempt to use hardware-accelerated video codecs when encoding and decoding video. Hardware acceleration can make transcoding faster and allow more simultaneous video transcodes, but it can also reduce video quality and compatibility.

HardwareAcceleratedEncoders.label: Use hardware-accelerated video encoding
HardwareAcceleratedEncoders.summary: If hardware acceleration is enabled, this controls whether it's used for encoding, in addition to decoding.

TranscodeCountLimit.label: Maximum simultaneous video transcode
TranscodeCountLimit.summary: Limit the number of simultaneous video transcode streams your server can utilize

DlnaEnabled.label: Enable the DLNA server
DlnaEnabled.summary: This allows the server to stream media to DLNA (Digital Living Network Alliance) devices.

DlnaClientPreferences.label: DLNA client preferences
DlnaClientPreferences.summary: Client-specific configuration settings for the DLNA server.

DlnaReportTimeline.label: DLNA server timeline reporting
DlnaReportTimeline.summary: Enable the DLNA server to report timelines for video play activity.

DlnaDefaultProtocolInfo.label: DLNA default protocol info
DlnaDefaultProtocolInfo.summary: Protocol info string used in GetProtocolInfo responses by the DLNA server.

DlnaDeviceDiscoveryInterval.label: DLNA media renderer discovery interval
DlnaDeviceDiscoveryInterval.summary: Number of seconds between DLNA media renderer discovery requests.

DlnaAnnouncementLeaseTime.label: DLNA server announcement lease time
DlnaAnnouncementLeaseTime.summary: Duration in seconds of DLNA Server SSDP announcement lease time.

DlnaDescriptionIcons.label: DLNA server description icons
DlnaDescriptionIcons.summary: Icons offered by DLNA server when devices request server description.

ButlerStartHour.label: Time at which tasks start to run
ButlerStartHour.summary: The time at which the server starts running background maintenance tasks.

ButlerEndHour.label: Time at which tasks stop running
ButlerEndHour.summary: The time at which the background maintenance tasks stop running.

ButlerDatabaseBackupPath.label: Backup directory
ButlerDatabaseBackupPath.summary: The directory in which database backups are stored.

ButlerTaskCleanOldCacheFiles.label: Remove old cache files every week

ButlerTaskRefreshLocalMedia.label: Refresh local metadata every three days

ButlerTaskDeepMediaAnalysis.label: Perform extensive media analysis during maintenance

ButlerTaskRefreshEpgGuides.label: Perform refresh of program guide data.

ButlerTaskReverseGeocode.label: Fetch missing location names for items in photo sections
